title: How to Brown a Roast for Cooking in a Crockpot

steps.title: Rinse the roast with cold water.
steps.content: Rinse the roast with cold water.

steps.title: Place the meat on a cutting board.
steps.content: Place the meat on a cutting board.

steps.title: Pat it dry with paper towels, pressing to absorb as much water as possible.
steps.content: Pat it dry with paper towels, pressing to absorb as much water as possible. [1] X Research source The drier the outside of the meat is, the easier it will be to coat it with seasoning, as well as to sear it. Searing turns into steaming if there is too much moisture on the surface of the meat and in the pan.

steps.title: Trim any excess fat off the meat.
steps.content: Trim any excess fat off the meat. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Cut the roast into smaller pieces if it is too large to fit into your crockpot.
steps.content: Cut the roast into smaller pieces if it is too large to fit into your crockpot. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Heat 2 tablespoons (30 mm) of cooking oil in a large Dutch oven on medium high heat.
steps.content: Heat 2 tablespoons (30 mm) of cooking oil in a large Dutch oven on medium high heat. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Sprinkle and rub salt and pepper all over the meat.
steps.content: Sprinkle and rub salt and pepper all over the meat. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Brown the meat in the hot oil for several minutes on each side.
steps.content: Brown the meat in the hot oil for several minutes on each side. Rotate it carefully so that the grease doesn’t splash onto your skin. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the seared meat and place it in the crockpot you’ll use to roast it.
steps.content: Remove the seared meat and place it in the crockpot you’ll use to roast it.
